news_items.headline: Coronavirus prompts Sony, NTT and Intel to join Barcelona congress exodus
news_items.lede: Japanese wireless carrier NTT Docomo <9437.T>, Sony Corp <6758.T> and California-based chip giant Intel Corp <INTC.O> pulled out of the Mobile World Congress (MWC) in Barcelona on Monday because of the coronavirus outbreak.
news_items.img_cap: An employee is pictured next to a banner with information of MWC20 (Mobile World Congress) in Barcelona, Spain February 10, 2020. REUTERS/Nacho Doce

news_items.headline: Intel bets on smart buildings in Israel to attract tech talent
news_items.lede: Intel Corp <INTC.O> is investing heavily in "smart buildings" in Israel that will be full of perks to keep employees happy, helping the U.S. chipmaker compete for the country's top professionals.
news_items.img_cap: Cars drive past U.S. chipmaker Intel Corp's "smart building" in Petah Tikva, near Tel Aviv, Israel December 15, 2019. REUTERS/Amir Cohen

news_items.headline: US STOCKS-Wall St slides on coronavirus fears, Intel offers support
news_items.lede: * Indexes down: Dow 0.44%, S&P 0.65%, Nasdaq 0.52% (Updates to early afternoon)

news_items.headline: Intel's blockbuster results lift shares to dotcom peak, fire up sector
news_items.lede: Intel Corp's <INTC.O> shares hit their highest in nearly two decades on Friday after cloud computing demand fired up the chipmaker's data center business and allayed concerns of market share loss to rival AMD, lifting stocks across the sector.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Computer chip maker Intel's logo is shown on a gaming computer display during the opening day of E3, the annual video games expo revealing the latest in gaming software and hardware in Los Angeles, California, U.S., June 11, 2019.  REUTERS/Mike Blake

news_items.headline: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Nasdaq hits record high on Intel strength
news_items.lede: The tech-heavy Nasdaq index hit a new high on Friday after a strong forecast from Intel and encouraging business activity data out of Europe, while concerns eased over the coronavirus outbreak in China.

news_items.headline: Intel's cloud growth lifts shares, fires up other chipmakers
news_items.lede: Intel Corp's shares rose 5% on Friday after demand from data centres fired up the chipmaker's cloud business and allayed concerns of market share loss to rival AMD, lifting shares across the sector.

news_items.headline: US STOCKS-Futures rise on gains in Intel, coronavirus fears linger
news_items.lede: U.S. stock index futures edged higher on Friday, as a strong forecast from chipmaker Intel and encouraging business activity data out of Europe lifted the mood as investors tracked latest developments related to the coronavirus outbreak.

news_items.headline: Intel signals 2020 will be a turnaround year for chip industry leader
news_items.lede: Intel Corp <INTC.O> on Thursday cemented the market view that the chip industry is turning around after a prolonged slowdown, forecasting better 2020 revenue and profit than Wall Street anticipated, driven by cloud computing demand.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A visitor passes an Intel logo at the Mobile World Congress in Barcelona, Spain, February 26, 2018. REUTERS/Sergio Perez/File Photo

news_items.headline: Intel forecasts 2020 revenue above estimates, shares rise
news_items.lede: Intel Corp forecast full-year revenue above analysts' estimates on Thursday, helped by higher sales of its chips used in data centers that power internet-based services, sending its shares up 5%.

news_items.headline: Intel's Mobileye demos autonomous car equipped only with cameras, no other sensors
news_items.lede: Intel Corp on Monday released a video of its Mobileye autonomous car navigating the streets of Jerusalem for about 20 minutes with the help of 12 on-board cameras and, unusually, no other sensors.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Intel's logo is pictured during preparations at the CeBit computer fair, which will open its doors to the public on March 20, at the fairground in Hanover, Germany, March 19, 2017.  REUTERS/Fabian Bimmer/File Photo

news_items.headline: Q&A: Intel patent lawyer Brad Waugh talks litigation finance
news_items.lede: As the associate general counsel who manages Intel Corp's patent lawsuits, Brad Waugh said he has had many brushes with litigation funders, who finance legal cases in exchange for a percentage of the settlement.

news_items.headline: Exclusive: Nvidia to win unconditional EU okay for $6.8 billion Mellanox buy - sources
news_items.lede: U.S. chipmaker Nvidia is set to win unconditional EU antitrust approval for its $6.8 billion acquisition of Mellanox Technologies <MLNX.O>, people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Nvidia Corporation is seen during the annual Computex computer exhibition in Taipei, Taiwan May 30, 2017. REUTERS/Tyrone Siu

news_items.headline: Intel buys Israeli AI startup Habana Labs for $2 billion
news_items.lede: Intel Corp has bought Israel-based artificial intelligence (AI) firm Habana Labs for about $2 billion, the chipmaker said on Monday, seeking to expand its AI portfolio to bolster its data-center business.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Intel logo is shown at E3, the world's largest video game industry convention in Los Angeles, California, U.S. June 12, 2018. REUTERS/Mike Blake/FIle Photo

news_items.headline: Intel acquires Israel-based Habana Labs for $2 bln
news_items.lede: Intel Corp has acquired Israel-based artificial intelligence firm Habana Labs for about $2 billion, the chipmaker said on Monday.

news_items.headline: Intel hires former GlobalFoundries, IBM chip executive
news_items.lede: Intel Corp <INTC.O> has hired Gary Patton, who was chief technology officer at semiconductor maker GlobalFoundries, according to an internal Intel memo seen by Reuters on Wednesday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Computer chip maker Intel's logo is shown on a gaming computer display during the opening day of E3, the annual video games expo revealing the latest in gaming software and hardware in Los Angeles, California, U.S., June 11, 2019. REUTERS/Mike Blake/File Photo

news_items.headline: Intel hires former GlobalFoundries, IBM chip manufacturing executive
news_items.lede: Intel Corp has hired Gary Patton, according to an internal Intel memo seen by Reuters on Wednesday.

news_items.headline: Intel creates chip to control quantum computers
news_items.lede: Quantum computers aim to carry out tasks in just a few minutes that would take today's best conventional computers thousands of years. But in nearly every photograph of the devices, there's a tangle of wires in the background connected to equipment that controls the quantum...
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Computer chip maker Intel's logo is shown on a gaming computer display during the opening day of E3, the annual video games expo revealing the latest in gaming software and hardware in Los Angeles, California, U.S., June 11, 2019. REUTERS/Mike Blake/File Photo

news_items.headline: U.S. Supreme Court skeptical of Intel in retirement fund dispute
news_items.lede: U.S. Supreme Court justices on Wednesday appeared skeptical of Intel Corp's bid to avoid a lawsuit accusing it of violating federal law in making employee retirement plan investments that cost beneficiaries hundreds of millions of dollars.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Computer chip maker Intel's logo is shown on a gaming computer display during the opening day of E3, the annual video games expo revealing the latest in gaming software and hardware in Los Angeles, California, U.S., June 11, 2019. REUTERS/Mike Blake

news_items.headline: Amazon designs more powerful data center chip
news_items.lede: (This December 3 story has been refiled to correct typo in paragraph 2)
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Staff chat at the front desk of the Amazon office in the Manhattan borough of New York, New York, U.S., May 1, 2019.   REUTERS/Carlo Allegri

news_items.headline: Intel seeks SCOTUS ruling that workers had 'actual knowledge' of ERISA plan details
news_items.lede: Intel Corp, represented by former U.S. Solicitor General Donald Verrilli, is set to urge the U.S. Supreme Court to rule that workers who challenge a retirement plan's investment strategy cannot extend the three-year window to file lawsuits by claiming they never read documents...

news_items.headline: Intel says Qualcomm tactics forced it out of modem chip market
news_items.lede: Intel Corp sold its smartphone modem chip business to Apple Inc at "a multi-billion dollar loss," the U.S. chipmaker said in a court filing on Friday, alleging that rival Qualcomm Inc forced it out of the market.

news_items.headline: Apple, Intel file antitrust case vs SoftBank-owned firm over patent practices
news_items.lede: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> and Intel Corp <INTC.O> on Wednesday filed an antitrust lawsuit against Fortress Investment Group, alleging the SoftBank Group Corp <9984.T> unit stockpiled patents to hold up tech firms with lawsuits demanding as much as $5.1 billion.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Apple Inc. logo is seen hanging at the Apple store on 5th Avenue in Manhattan, New York, U.S., October 16, 2019. REUTERS/Mike Segar/File Photo

news_items.headline: RPT-Apple, Intel file antitrust case against SoftBank-backed firm over patent practices
news_items.lede: Apple Inc and Intel Corp on Wednesday filed an antitrust lawsuit against Softbank Group Corp-owned Fortress Investment Group, alleging the firm stockpiled patents to hold up technology companies with lawsuits.

news_items.headline: Apple, Intel file antitrust case against SoftBank-backed firm over patent practices
news_items.lede: Apple Inc and Intel Corp on Wednesday filed an antitrust lawsuit against Softbank Group Corp-owned Fortress Investment Group, alleging the firm stockpiled patents to hold up technology companies with lawsuits.

news_items.headline: Intel says chip supply for personal computers remains tight
news_items.lede: Intel Corp <INTC.O> said on Wednesday it was increasing its reliance on contract chip manufacturers to ramp up supply of chips used in personal computers as the company struggles with shipment delays amid higher demand.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Computer chip maker Intel's logo is shown on a gaming computer display during the opening day of E3, the annual video games expo revealing the latest in gaming software and hardware in Los Angeles, California, U.S., June 11, 2019.  REUTERS/Mike Blake

news_items.headline: Chipmaker Intel says supply remains tight in PC business; shares slip
news_items.lede: Intel Corp said on Wednesday it has not been able to keep up with the increasing demand for CPUs and said supply remained "extremely tight" in its personal computer business.

news_items.headline: Former Apple chip executives found company to take on Intel, AMD
news_items.lede: Three of Apple Inc's former top semiconductor executives in charge of iPhone chips have founded a startup to design processors for data centers, aiming to take on current industry leaders Intel Corp and Advanced Micro Devices Inc.
news_items.img_cap: NUVIA Inc co-founders John Bruno, Gerard Williams III and Manu Gulati pose at the company’s Santa Clara, California headquarters, U.S., in this undated handout photo released on November 15, 2019. Courtesy NUVIA Inc/Handout via REUTERS

news_items.headline: Nvidia follows Intel to predict strong growth in data center business
news_items.lede: Nvidia Corp <NVDA.O> on Thursday joined rival Intel Corp <INTC.O> to predict strong demand for chips used in data centers after its third-quarter revenue and profit beat market expectations.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: NVIDIA computer graphic cards are shown for sale at a retail store in San Marcos, California, U.S. August 14, 2018.  REUTERS/Mike Blake

news_items.headline: Nio, Mobileye partner on self-driving consumer passenger cars in China
news_items.lede: Chinese electric car startup Nio Inc <NIO.N> and Intel Corp's <INTC.O> self-driving car technology firm Mobileye on Tuesday said they would partner to develop autonomous vehicles for the consumer market in China and eventually other countries.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Chinese electric vehicle start-up NIO Inc. logo is on display in front of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) to celebrate the company’s initial public offering (IPO) in New York, U.S., September 12, 2018.  REUTERS/Brendan McDermid

news_items.headline: Micron launches new storage drives to challenge Intel in data centers
news_items.lede: (The October 24 story corrects to reflect that Micron's new devices are solid-state drives rather than hard drives with spinning disks.)
news_items.img_cap: Micron Technology's solid-state drive for data center customers is presented at a product launch event in San Francisco, U.S., October 24, 2019. REUTERS/Stephen Nellis

news_items.headline: US STOCKS-Intel results push Wall Street higher
news_items.lede: * Indexes: Dow 0.38%, S&P 0.16%, Nasdaq 0.24% (Updates to open)

news_items.headline: US STOCKS-S&P, Nasdaq futures inch up as Intel results ease trade worries
news_items.lede: S&P 500 and Nasdaq futures edged higher on Friday as robust earnings from Intel helped ease worries about the impact of an ongoing trade war on chipmakers, but underwhelming results from Amazon.com hit sentiment.

news_items.headline: Intel data center rebound eases U.S.-China trade war worries
news_items.lede: Intel Corp <INTC.O> on Thursday beat Wall Street estimates for third-quarter revenue and profit and raised its full-year revenue forecast, powered by sales to data centers and easing concerns about slowing demand during the U.S.-China trade war.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Intel logo is shown at E3, the world's largest video game industry convention in Los Angeles, California, U.S. June 12, 2018. REUTERS/Mike Blake

news_items.headline: Intel raises full year revenue forecast
news_items.lede: Intel Corp raised its full-year revenue forecast on Thursday, easing concerns about a long-drawn slowdown in demand that has also been fueled by the U.S.-China trade war.

news_items.headline: Intel files antitrust case against SoftBank-backed firm over patent practices
news_items.lede: Chipmaker Intel Corp has filed an antitrust lawsuit against a SoftBank Group Corp-owned investment company alleging the firm stockpiled patents to hold up technology companies with numerous lawsuits.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Intel logo is displayed on computer screens at SIGGRAPH 2017 in Los Angeles, California, U.S. July 31, 2017.  REUTERS/Mike Blake

news_items.headline: Intel files antitrust case against SoftBank-backed firm over patent practices
news_items.lede: Chipmaker Intel Corp has filed an antitrust lawsuit against a SoftBank Group Corp-owned investment company alleging the firm stockpiled patents to hold up technology companies with numerous lawsuits.

news_items.headline: Intel buys software business from Canada's Pivot Technology in 5G push
news_items.lede: Intel Corp <INTC.O> has agreed to purchase a software business from Toronto-based Pivot Technology Solutions Inc <PTG.TO> for $27 million, the U.S. chipmaker said on Tuesday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Computer chip maker Intel's logo is shown on a gaming computer display during the opening day of E3, the annual video games expo revealing the latest in gaming software and hardware in Los Angeles, California, U.S., June 11, 2019.  REUTERS/Mike Blake

news_items.headline: Intel buys software business from Canada's Pivot Technology in 5G push
news_items.lede: California chipmaker Intel Corp has agreed to purchase a software business from Toronto-based information technology firm Pivot Technology Solutions Inc , Intel said on Tuesday.

news_items.headline: Intel to use Tokyo Olympics to show off 3D tracking, other new tech
news_items.lede: Tech giant Intel Corp said on Wednesday it will use the Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games to show off a portfolio of new technology including artificial intelligence driven 3D tracking of athletes to augment broadcasts of events during the Games.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Intel logo is shown at E3, the world's largest video game industry convention in Los Angeles, California, U.S. June 12, 2018. REUTERS/Mike Blake/File Photo

news_items.headline: Intel unveils first artificial intelligence chip Springhill
news_items.lede: Intel Corp on Tuesday unveiled its latest processor that will be its first using artificial intelligence (AI) and is designed for large computing centers.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Computer chip maker Intel's logo is shown on a gaming computer display during the opening day of E3, the annual video games expo revealing the latest in gaming software and hardware in Los Angeles, California, U.S., June 11, 2019.  REUTERS/Mike Blake

news_items.headline: CORRECTED (OFFICIAL)-Intel launches first artificial intelligence chip Springhill
news_items.lede: Intel Corp on Tuesday launched its latest processor that will be its first using artificial intelligence (AI) and is designed for large computing centres.

news_items.headline: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Alphabet, Intel earnings boost Wall Street at open
news_items.lede: Wall Street's main indexes opened higher on Friday, as robust earnings from Google-owner Alphabet and Intel spurred a rally in technology stocks and data showed the U.S. economy slowed less than expected in the second quarter.

news_items.headline: US STOCKS-Strong Alphabet, Intel earnings drive futures higher
news_items.lede: Robust earnings from Google-owner Alphabet and Intel lifted U.S. stock index futures on Friday, as investors await data that is widely expected to show that the domestic economy grew at its slowest pace in over two years in the second quarter.

news_items.headline: Apple pays $1 billion for Intel unit in push for chip independence
news_items.lede: Apple Inc took a major step toward supplying its own smartphone chips by purchasing the majority of Intel Corp's modem business in a deal valued at $1 billion, the companies said on Thursday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Apple is seen at a store in Zurich, Switzerland January 3, 2019.   REUTERS/Arnd Wiegmann

news_items.headline: Intel says customers stockpiling chips on U.S.-China tension, hikes forecast
news_items.lede: Intel Corp forecast current-quarter profit and revenue above estimates and raised its full-year revenue forecast on Thursday, allaying concerns about a global semiconductor sales slowdown and curbs on U.S. sales to China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Computer chip maker Intel's logo is shown on a gaming computer display during the opening day of E3, the annual video games expo revealing the latest in gaming software and hardware in Los Angeles, California, U.S., June 11, 2019.  REUTERS/Mike Blake/File Photo

news_items.headline: Intel beats profit, revenue estimates
news_items.lede: Intel Corp beat analysts' estimates for quarterly revenue and profit on Thursday, raising hopes that a recent slump in chip demand aggravated by the U.S.-Sino trade war was easing.

news_items.headline: Apple to buy majority of Intel's modem chip business for $1 bln
news_items.lede: Apple Inc said on Thursday it would buy the majority of Intel Corp's smartphone modem business for $1 billion, months after the chipmaker announced plans to exit the 5G modem chip business.

news_items.headline: Apple in advanced talks to buy Intel's smartphone-modem chip business: WSJ
news_items.lede: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> is in advanced talks to buy chipmaker Intel Corp's <INTC.O> smartphone-modem chip business, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the matter.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Apple is seen at a store in Zurich, Switzerland January 3, 2019.   REUTERS/Arnd Wiegmann

news_items.headline: Apple in advanced talks to buy Intel's smartphone-modem chip business - WSJ
news_items.lede: Apple Inc is in advanced talks to buy chipmaker Intel Corp's smartphone-modem chip business, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the matter.

news_items.headline: Engineer says Intel favored Indian workers in promotions, time off
news_items.lede: Intel Corp has been hit with a lawsuit by a Korean-born software engineer in California who claims he was denied a promotion after complaining about the tech giant's preferential treatment of workers of Indian and South Asian descent.

news_items.headline: Intel launches project to help Israeli tech start-ups
news_items.lede: Intel Corp launched a project on Sunday to help start-ups in Israel develop technologies in artificial intelligence (AI) and autonomous systems, and said it planned to bring the scheme to other countries as well.
news_items.img_cap: Intel CEO Robert Swan speaks during a roundtable event with members of the media in Tel Aviv, Israel June 16, 2019. REUTERS/Amir Cohen

news_items.headline: Intel launches tech accelerator in Israel, plans for more
news_items.lede: Intel Corp on Sunday launched an accelerator in Israel to develop technologies in artificial intelligence and autonomous systems, and said it plans to bring the project to other countries as well.

news_items.headline: U.S. Supreme Court to hear Intel retirement fund dispute
news_items.lede: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday agreed to hear Intel Corp's bid to avoid a lawsuit accusing it of violating federal law in making employee retirement plan investments that cost beneficiaries hundreds of millions of dollars.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Intel logo is shown at E3, the world's largest video game industry convention in Los Angeles, California, U.S. June 12, 2018. REUTERS/Mike Blake/File Photo

news_items.headline: U.S. Supreme Court to hear Intel retirement fund dispute
news_items.lede: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday agreed to hear Intel Corp's bid to avoid a lawsuit accusing it of violating federal law in making employee retirement plan investments that cost beneficiaries hundreds of millions of dollars.

news_items.headline: New Intel security flaws could slow some chips by nearly 20%
news_items.lede: Intel Corp and a group of security researchers on Tuesday said they had found a new set of security flaws in its processors that will be difficult to fix and are related to problems found last year.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Intel logo is shown at E3, the world's largest video game industry convention in Los Angeles, California, U.S. June 12, 2018. REUTERS/Mike Blake/File Photo

news_items.headline: Intel shares drop, three-year outlook seen lagging rivals
news_items.lede: Intel Corp shares declined 2.5 percent on Wednesday after executives forecast modest profit growth over the next three years, signaling it is likely to lag big rivals as the once-dominant chipmaker catches up in technology.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A sign outside the Intel corporate campus in Hillsboro, Oregon, U.S., April 25, 2018. REUTERS/Caroline Humer/File Photo

news_items.headline: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-S&P 500 dips as Intel slide counters trade hopes
news_items.lede: The S&P 500 fell on Wednesday as a late slide in shares of Intel Corp erased earlier gains fueled by hopeful notes from the White House regarding the status of trade negotiations with China.

news_items.headline: Intel to launch 7nm chip products in 2021
news_items.lede: Intel Corp Chief Executive Officer Bob Swan said on Wednesday the chipmaker would produce and launch its 7 nanometer (nm) chip products in 2021.
